CatDescriptText: Harvey Turner, laborer, 2128 Elmore Street and Leon Clayborne, restaurant worker, Terrace Village were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 22, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think Negro voters consider local or national issues in the casting of their votes?" Mr. Turner's answer reads: "Probably, they think first of national issues, like segregation and schools...I cast my vote in consideration of national issues...The national issues are more important to the Negro, I think, because they have a more direct bearing on civil rights."  Mr. Clayborne's answer reads: "I think the votes are cast after consideration of local issues."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Harvey Turner wearing plaid button down collared shirt and cap, standing in front of dark column and sign; Portrait of Leon Clayborne wearing light colored short sleeve button down collared shirt and moustache, standing on street with truck and building
